ðŸŒŸ dline | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing and interacting with a calendar from the command line.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Dynamic calendar view with color-coded categories and filtering â€¢ Static monthly calendar view â€¢ Event calculator for determining workdays between dates â€¢ Calendar data management (add, delete, update, clean) â€¢ Import/export events from various sources (TSV, GCA, OHA)
ðŸ“– Summary: dLine is a command-line calendar tool written in Shell. It allows users to manage events, calculate timespans, and manage multiple calendars directly from the terminal. It offers dynamic and static calendar views, event calculation, and data management features.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ sablier | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: On-demand starting and automatic stopping of containerized workloads to conserve resources.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Supports Docker, Docker Swarm, and Kubernetes â€¢ Supports Apache APISIX, Caddy, Envoy, Istio, Nginx (NJS Module), Nginx (WASM Module), and Traefik reverse proxies â€¢ Automatic workload scaling upon first request with themable waiting page and hanging request strategy
ðŸ“– Summary: Sablier is a free and open-source software that automatically starts and stops containerized workloads based on demand and inactivity. It supports Docker, Docker Swarm, and Kubernetes, along with multiple reverse proxies, acting as a serverless platform for your own servers to optimize resource usage.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ reddix | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Browsing and interacting with Reddit from the terminal.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ image preview based on kitty graphics protocol â€¢ video playback through mpv's Kitty integration â€¢ gallery browsing with inline navigation controls â€¢ multi-account support â€¢ keyboard first navigation
ðŸ“– Summary: Reddix is a terminal-based Reddit client written in Rust. It provides a refined Reddit experience within the terminal, offering features like image preview, video playback, gallery browsing, multi-account support, and keyboard-first navigation.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ whitemax | Smali
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Reducing network activity and enhancing the security of the MAX messenger application.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Reduces network activity of MAX messenger â€¢ Provides a secure modification â€¢ Offers pre-built APK for easy installation â€¢ Includes instructions for building from source
ðŸ“– Summary: The WhiteMAX Mod is a free and secure modification for the MAX messenger app, focused on reducing the application's network activity. It provides a modified APK for direct installation and instructions for building from source using tools like apktool and apksign.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ oceanbase | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Distributed relational database for transactional, analytical, and AI workloads.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Vector Search â€¢ Transparent Scalability â€¢ Ultra-fast Performance â€¢ Cost Efficiency â€¢ Real-time Analytics
ðŸ“– Summary: OceanBase is a distributed relational database developed by Ant Group, designed for transactional, analytical, and AI workloads. It leverages the Paxos protocol for high availability and linear scalability, supporting features like vector search, transparent scalability, ultra-fast performance, cost efficiency, and real-time analytics.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ slatedb | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Embedded storage for applications requiring scalable and durable data storage in cloud environments.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Cloud-native embedded storage â€¢ LSM-tree architecture â€¢ Object storage backend (S3, GCS, etc.) â€¢ Batch writes to mitigate API costs â€¢ Configurable flush interval
ðŸ“– Summary: SlateDB is an embedded storage engine built on a log-structured merge-tree (LSM-tree) architecture. It distinguishes itself by writing data to object storage (like S3, GCS), providing bottomless storage, high durability, and easy replication, trading off latency and API costs compared to local disk.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ speedtest-tracker | PHP
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Monitoring internet connection performance and uptime.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automated Tests â€¢ Detailed Metrics â€¢ Historical Data â€¢ Notifications
ðŸ“– Summary: Speedtest Tracker is a self-hosted application designed to monitor the performance and uptime of an internet connection. It automates speed tests, captures detailed metrics like download/upload speeds and ping, and provides historical data and notifications to identify internet performance issues.
